title: Subjunctive Mood
description: Слушайте сослагательное наклонение в формальных контекстах.

tasks.audioText: The board reviewed the quarterly results. The chairman insisted that the CEO be present at the next shareholders' meeting.
tasks.transcript: The chairman insisted that the CEO be present at the next shareholders' meeting.

options.text: The CEO was already present at the meeting.
The chairman demanded the CEO's attendance at the upcoming meeting.
The chairman suggested cancelling the meeting.
The CEO refused to attend any future meetings.

tasks.explanation: 'Insisted that ... be' is the formal subjunctive used after verbs of demand. It means the chairman demanded attendance.

tasks.audioText: The professor addressed the committee about academic standards. She recommended that every student submit a revised thesis by Friday.
tasks.transcript: She recommended that every student submit a revised thesis by Friday.

options.text: Students already submitted their theses.
The professor rejected all the theses.
Her recommendation was for all students to hand in updated theses by Friday.
She asked students to submit theses next month.

tasks.explanation: 'Recommended that ... submit' uses the subjunctive base form after 'recommend'. It expresses a suggestion, not a completed action.

tasks.audioText: The doctor examined the patient thoroughly. It is essential that he take the medication exactly as prescribed.
tasks.transcript: It is essential that he take the medication exactly as prescribed.

options.text: He must follow the prescription precisely when taking his medication.
He has already taken all the prescribed medication.
The doctor refused to prescribe any medication.
He can take the medication whenever he wants.

tasks.explanation: 'It is essential that he take' uses the mandative subjunctive to express necessity. The base form 'take' (not 'takes') signals a strong requirement.

tasks.audioText: The economic crisis worsened across the region. The finance minister proposed that the government reduce taxes immediately.
tasks.transcript: The finance minister proposed that the government reduce taxes immediately.

options.text: The government already reduced taxes last year.
The minister wanted to raise taxes immediately.
The minister put forward an immediate tax cut proposal.
The minister refused to discuss tax policy.

tasks.explanation: 'Proposed that ... reduce' uses the subjunctive after 'propose'. The base form indicates a formal suggestion, not a past action.

tasks.audioText: If I were in your position, I would negotiate a higher salary before accepting the offer.
tasks.transcript: If I were in your position, I would negotiate a higher salary before accepting the offer.

options.text: The speaker already negotiated a higher salary.
The speaker advises negotiating for more money before taking the job.
The speaker thinks the salary is already fair.
The speaker rejected the job offer entirely.

tasks.explanation: 'If I were' is the subjunctive expressing a hypothetical situation. The speaker is giving advice about what they would do in that situation.

tasks.audioText: The environmental agency issued new guidelines. They demanded that each factory install filtration systems within six months.
tasks.transcript: They demanded that each factory install filtration systems within six months.

options.text: Factories were given a six-month deadline to set up filtration equipment.
Factories already have filtration systems installed.
The agency suggested optional improvements.
Factories were shut down permanently.

tasks.explanation: 'Demanded that ... install' uses the mandative subjunctive after 'demand'. It conveys a compulsory requirement with a specific timeframe.

tasks.audioText: The judge deliberated carefully over the evidence. She ordered that the defendant remain in custody until the trial.
tasks.transcript: She ordered that the defendant remain in custody until the trial.

options.text: The defendant was released on bail.
The trial was cancelled by the judge.
The judge ruled that the accused must stay detained until the court hearing.
The defendant had already served the full sentence.

tasks.explanation: 'Ordered that ... remain' uses the subjunctive to express a judicial directive. The defendant must stay in custody.

tasks.audioText: The university senate met to discuss admissions policy. It was suggested that the entrance exam be made more rigorous.
tasks.transcript: It was suggested that the entrance exam be made more rigorous.

options.text: The entrance exam was eliminated entirely.
Someone proposed increasing the difficulty of the admissions test.
The exam was already very difficult.
Students requested an easier entrance exam.

tasks.explanation: 'It was suggested that ... be made' combines the passive subjunctive with a suggestion. It conveys a proposal to increase exam difficulty.

tasks.audioText: The ambassador addressed the press after the summit. He urged that both nations cease hostilities without further delay.
tasks.transcript: He urged that both nations cease hostilities without further delay.

options.text: The ambassador declared war on both nations.
He wanted the conflict to continue indefinitely.
The ambassador called for an immediate end to the fighting between the countries.
Both nations had already signed a peace treaty.

tasks.explanation: 'Urged that ... cease' uses the subjunctive after 'urge' to express a strong appeal for immediate action to stop conflict.

tasks.audioText: She spoke as though she were the leading authority on the subject, but her credentials were questionable.
tasks.transcript: She spoke as though she were the leading authority on the subject, but her credentials were questionable.

options.text: She was genuinely the top expert in the field.
Her manner of speaking suggested expertise, yet her qualifications were doubtful.
Everyone agreed she was perfectly qualified.
She refused to speak about the subject at all.

tasks.explanation: 'As though she were' uses the subjunctive to describe an unreal comparison. She behaved like an expert, but she might not be one.

tasks.audioText: The safety committee reviewed the incident report. They required that the contractor rectify the structural flaws before reopening.
tasks.transcript: They required that the contractor rectify the structural flaws before reopening.

options.text: The building was reopened without any repairs.
The contractor was asked to fix structural problems prior to reopening.
The committee praised the contractor's excellent work.
The structural flaws were deemed insignificant.

tasks.explanation: 'Required that ... rectify' uses the subjunctive after 'require'. The committee mandated that flaws must be fixed before reopening.

tasks.audioText: The artistic director reviewed the casting decisions for the new production. She insisted that the lead role go to a lesser-known actor.
tasks.transcript: She insisted that the lead role go to a lesser-known actor.

options.text: She wanted a famous celebrity for the lead role.
She cancelled the entire production.
She demanded that a relatively unknown performer be cast as the lead.
The lead role had already been assigned to a star.

tasks.explanation: 'Insisted that ... go' uses the subjunctive after 'insist' to express a strong demand about casting the part.

tasks.audioText: The research ethics board convened an emergency session. It was imperative that the clinical trial be halted pending further review.
tasks.transcript: It was imperative that the clinical trial be halted pending further review.

options.text: The clinical trial continued without interruption.
It was critically necessary to stop the trial until a further assessment was completed.
The ethics board approved the trial unconditionally.
The review had already been completed before the trial.

tasks.explanation: 'It was imperative that ... be halted' uses the adjective-triggered subjunctive to express urgent necessity to pause the trial.

tasks.audioText: Far be it from me to question your judgement, but I think the investment strategy needs reconsideration.
tasks.transcript: Far be it from me to question your judgement, but I think the investment strategy needs reconsideration.

options.text: The speaker fully supports the current investment strategy.
The speaker has no opinion on financial matters.
The speaker politely suggests that the investment approach should be rethought.
The speaker is directly criticizing someone's intelligence.

tasks.explanation: 'Far be it from me' is a formulaic subjunctive expressing polite reluctance before offering criticism. The speaker diplomatically suggests a change.

tasks.audioText: The editorial board debated the newspaper's coverage. The editor-in-chief proposed that each journalist be assigned a specific investigative beat.
tasks.transcript: The editor-in-chief proposed that each journalist be assigned a specific investigative beat.

options.text: Journalists were fired from the newspaper.
All journalists would cover the same stories.
The editor suggested keeping everything as it was.
The editor proposed giving each reporter a dedicated area of investigation.

tasks.explanation: 'Proposed that ... be assigned' uses the passive subjunctive after 'propose'. The editor suggested a structural change in how journalists work.
